Change has been successfully merged

going forward , we should ideally have two ways to add this support:
1. Use entity aux names PDR to get the name of the fru from the remote entity and stick that in the object path.
2. If there are no aux names PDR's present, then we could fall back to use this static json file to get the object name.
yes, we will get more idea once AUX PDR implementation is done, then will do change as per suggestion
can you write briefly what challenges that led to this change?
done
add some example and documentation on how this JSON file should be used.
added description as json format since comments are not allowed in json
parseEntityMap
done
do we really need this as a class variable ? why cant the parseFunction return the JSON object directly.

we can, but there are 3 reason.
1. storing json object v/s storing map => same thing 
2. map value comparison v/s jason value comparison which need to convert and compare which is redundant operation.
3. map is easy to find value
why did we move these functions from common/utils to host-bmc/utils? Is there a strong reason?
there are cyclic dependency between common/util.hpp and host_pdr_handler.hpp, so to avoid reference issue at multiple places better to use separate file.
we could add this in common/utils also right?
no this cannot be a common one, because it needs a certain json format.
there are cyclic dependency between common/util.hpp and host_pdr_handler.hpp, so to avoid reference issue at multiple places better to use separate file.
why do we have the same entityMap.json file in oem-ibm also and in the default path as well? Can we not keep oem-ibm alone?
it's not same entitymap.json file, system value is different from default config and oem config path.

should be along the lines of 
`Add JSON config support for entity to dbus string conversion`
above line exceeds 5o character so, tried to comprise as possible.
unit test passed.
updated.
entity type
updated.
does not look grammatically correct, please rephrase this in a better way , i think we dont need to mention about std::map here ?
typo
corrected commit message.
corrected commit message.

this has grammatical issues as well , please rephrase this.

please provide a sample entity association PDR from pldmtool and also explain what object path will be generated by it as an example. that will be trivial to understand than the words.
corrected commit message.
`EntityTypeToDbusStringMap`
done
might wanna do this directly during initialization of the object.
done

this assumes the JSON is already 19 element, instead we need to have a test.json in side the test , we dont want this test to be broken/make change to this test every time some one adds a new entry into the JSON.
created separate json for testing as suggested.
i think moving the functions updateEntityAssociation() and others into host-bmc/utils -> needs to be in a separate commit below the commit that adds the parsing capability.
separate it and the commmit link is:https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/71335
rather than filling the map here, can this parseFunction just parse the JSON file and return a JSON object. That way this becomes easy to unit test with an JSON file.

if we return json object then still getting value and converting to int & string is still pending so better to do all the work at single function and use data where ever needed.
updated parsing logic by using transform algorithm.
same set of comments from the other json applies here.
done
Changes looks good to me, small nit pick comment
format
Done

prefer strtol() instead of using atoi() which is not safe.

from https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/atoi.html 

```
The atoi() function is subsumed by strtol() but is retained because it is used extensively in existing code. If the number is not known to be in range, strtol() should be used because atoi() is not required to perform any error checking
```
changes done as per suggestion
why were these changes done? can you bring it back?
it's part of refactoring code, new line between each line looks not good
